intro: Oenothera phlebophylla, commonly known as the redstem evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant belongs to the Onagraceae family and is known for its showy, tubular flowers that attract nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Oenothera phlebophylla is also noted for its ability to tolerate arid conditions and is often found in desert environments.
